discussion.p: The description of ios_base::iword() and pword() in , say that if they fail, they "set badbit, which may throw an exception". However, ios_base offers no interface to set or to test badbit; those interfaces are defined in basic_ios<>.

resolution.p: Change the description in in paragraph 2, and also in paragraph 4, as follows. Replace

blockquote.p: If the function fails it sets badbit, which may throw an exception.

If the function fails, and *this is a base sub-object of a basic_ios<> object or sub-object, the effect is equivalent to calling basic_ios<>::setstate(badbit) on the derived object (which may throw failure).

resolution.note: Kona: LWG reviewed wording; setstate(failbit) changed to setstate(badbit).
